the .
i don't know how to say that .
djembe .
djembe is a drum from west africa .
the word jj djembe .
djembe .
djembe means everyone come together in peace .
this drum pl .
is played to tell a story .
people often come together to play their drum in a group .
three or four may be played together in a drum circle .
people come together to hear the drum music .
and they like to dance to the beat .
they also tell a story with their dancing .
a djembe hahas a shell made of hh hh .
made of hard wood .
is made from the skin of a goat .
it can be different sizes .
this kind of drum can be two to fifteen inches around .
as high as twenty three to twenty five inches tall .
it can be eleven .
to twenty nine pounds .
this kind of drum can make .
different kinds of sounds .
it can make a low ss .
sound low or a sound high or it can sound how .
the music can also be quiet .
or it can be very loud .
a long time ago, only the men would play a drum .
it was rare to see a woman play a drum in west africa .
so people were surprised when they saw a woman djembe player .
they the woman had to work very hard to get to play .
now, there are women drum circles .
and the women are just as good as playing music as the men .
this kind of drum was first played in west africa .
but now it is played all over the world !
it is even played in our country !
next time you listen to music, you may hear the best beat of the .
djembe .
djembe in the song .
good job !
can you read another one ?
one second .
you want to use your finger to follow along ?
does that help ?
yes .
it is a fact that some kids do not eat right .
if kids don't eat healthy foods, they can get sick .
to your best, you must eat right .
i wanted to help kids eat right .
so i started a garden at the ss .
at school .
like the garden at the white house .
i asked my friends at school to help me .
and they said yes !
they were really excited .
then i asked my teacher missus burns to help us .
that is such a good idea theo, missus burns said .
i would be happy to help !
missus miss burns asked our principal if we could use a part of the playground to make to make a raised garden bed .
the principal said yes !
i asked my grandfather to help us too .
my grandfather said yes !
he he was an excellent builder .
and he he made the raised bed for us .
in early spring miss burns helped us plant seeds in cups in our classroom .
we watched the seeds sprout through the soil and grow to seedlings .
in may, it was time to plant the seedlings .
we grew lots of vegetables .
we had to make sure the plants had plenty of water in the summer .
we took turns coming to school to take care of the plants .
by july, the garden was looking great !
there were lots of vegetables .
and they tasted fresh !
when school started again, there were plenty of vegetables .
so all the helpers had fresh vegetables for lunch !
in the fall, we had a harvest party to celebrate the garden .
it felt good to work hard on the garden and know that we helped children eat healthy .
good job you're really good at using the exclamation points !
thanks .
last page .
this week my grandma came to visit us .

this is the rosa parks !
this story takes place in nineteen fifty five .
one day, rosa parks rosa parks had a long day at work .
rosa was forty two years old .
she was black .
she waited for the bus to go home .
she was very tire tired .
rosa got on the bus .
and sat down .
the the seat she sat was in the front of the bus .
in nineteen fifty five, the city she lived in .
lived in .
lived in had an unfair law .
the law stated .
that if there were not enough seats on the bus for white people, black people must let the white people sit in their seats .
soon after rosa got on the bus, but the seats were full full .
then, more white people got on the bus .
the white people waited for rosa to get up from her seat .
rosa didn't think it was fair .
she did not want to be treated poorly poorly any longer just because she was black .
she said no .
and did not give up her seat .
rosa parks was arrested .
and put in jail .
many people found out what had happened .
some didn't think it was fair .
and felt mad .
so the black people in her town decided, we are not going to ride the bus until the law is changed .
for one year black people did not ride the bus .
finally, the law was fixed .
rosa parks helped black people to be tretreated fairly .
she was a role model and a leader .
all across the united states, people begin to insist on being treated fairly .

djembe .
djembe is a drum from west africa .
the word djembe means everyone comes together in peace .
the drum is played to tell a story .
people often come together to play their drum in a group .
three or four may be played together to make a drum circle .
people come together to hear the drum .
and they like to dance with the beat .
the people also tell a story with their dancing .
the .
what was ?
djembe ?
a djembe .
has a shell made of hard wood .
the top is made from the skin of a goat .
it can be different sizes .
this kind of drum can be twelve to fifteen inches around .
as high as twenty three to twenty five inches tall .
it can be eleven to nine .
wait .
twenty nine pounds .
this kind of drum can make different kinds of sounds .
it can be very low .
or it can be very high .
the music can also be quiet or can be very loud .
a long time ago only the men would play a drum .
it was rare to see a woman play a drum in west africa ss .
so people were surprised when they saw a woman djembe player .
the woman had to work very hard to get to play .
now there are women drum circlers .
and the women are just as good as playing music as the men .
the kind of drum first played in west africa .
but now it is played all over the world .
it is even seen in our country .
the next time you listen to music you may hear the beat of a djembe in the song .

a peace blanket is a way for children from all over the world to make a wish for peace .
it is a large blanket made with many different pieces of cloth .
peace is when we follow the law .
it is when we are calm, when we do not fight and when we get along .
we can show peace by a handshake or a hug .
some people show it with two fingers in the shape of a v .
like that ?
how can kids make peace ?
kids can make it if they talk with people about problems when feeling calm .
kids can make it feel .
can, sorry .
kids can make it if they ask people for help .
kids can make it if they walk away from fight .
from a fight .
kids can make peace if they are kind to others .
kids can make it when helping others .
wuhwhere can kids make peace ?
kids can make it inside of their minds .
kids can make it in their house .
kids can make it in school, in church, and in the neighborhood .
they can make it in their city, state, and their country .
kids have to work together to make peace .
to make peace blanket .
to make a peace blanket, each person gets one piece of cloth .
each piece tells a story .
each person tells a story with a picture on his or her piece .
the picture tells a story of what peace means to that person .
then all the kids put their pieces together to tell a big story .
each piece has a different color and shape .
all the pieces put together make one big blanket .
what did you do to make peace ?
i be kind to one another ?
that's when you talk about being kind, calm, not fighting with others .
awesome !
